{"step_by_step_thinking": "The yellowish white soft sticky deposit loosely adherent present on tooth surface is not food debris, as this is typically removed easily and does not adhere strongly to the teeth. It is also not materia alba, which is a white, loosely adherent mass of bacteria and cellular debris that forms on top of plaque. Calculus, also known as tartar, is a hard, mineralized deposit that forms from plaque, but the description in the question refers to a soft, sticky deposit. Therefore, the correct answer is plaque, which is a soft, sticky film that builds up on your teeth and contains millions of bacteria.", "answer_choice": "C. Plaque"}
